meanings.definition: Treat (a person, group, or concept) as insignificant or peripheral.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the main character felt marginalized by their classmates.
meanings.sent2: The community marginalized those who were different from them.
meanings.sent3: The cat felt marginalized when the new puppy arrived and stole all the attention.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were often marginalized in meetings, making her feel unheard.
meanings.sent5: The marginalized group finally found a voice and stood up for their rights.

meanings.definition: Relating to or situated at the edge or margin of something.
meanings.sent1: The marginalized area of the park was quiet and peaceful.
meanings.sent2: She preferred sitting in the marginalized seats at the back of the theater.
meanings.sent3: The marginalized cookies at the party were surprisingly the most delicious.
meanings.sent4: The marginalized section of the garden bloomed beautifully in the spring.
meanings.sent5: The marginalized book on the shelf caught her eye with its unique cover.

meanings.definition: To relegate to an unimportant or powerless position within a society or group.
meanings.sent1: The dictator marginalized anyone who opposed his rule.
meanings.sent2: She feared being marginalized by her colleagues if she spoke up against the decision.
meanings.sent3: The vegetables were marginalized on his plate as he focused on the steak.
meanings.sent4: The new policy marginalized the voices of the minority groups.
meanings.sent5: The student council's decision marginalized the concerns of the student body.
